results.name: a(n) = n mod 8.
comment: The rightmost digit in the base-8 representation of n. Also, the equivalent value of the three rightmost digits in the base-2 representation of n. - _Hieronymus Fischer_, Jun 12 2007
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..65536
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,0,0,0,0,0,0,1).
formula: Complex representation: a(n) = (1/8)*(1-r^n)*Sum_{k=1..7} k*Product_{m=1..7, m<>k} (1 - r^(n-m)) where r = exp(Pi/4*i) = (1+i)*sqrt(2)/2 and i=sqrt(-1).

General formula for period 2^k: a(n) = (1/2)*(2^k - 1 - Sum_{j=0..k-1} 2^j*(-1)^p(j,n)) where p(j,n) is defined recursively by p(0,n)=n, p(j,n) = (1/4)*(2*p(j-1,n) - 1 + (-1)^p(j-1,n)). - _Hieronymus Fischer_, Jun 14 2007
